												6/10This game is alright, it feels like a mashup of THPS 1-3 with some new skaters. The game itself is visually appealing, but I am dissapointed that the only option in the graphics menu is the ability to alter the resolution, this is a little shabby for a modern PC port. The selection of levels is OK, although personally I feel they could have added a few more to the mix, such as downtown minneapolis from THPS1, Skate street from THPS2. My only problem with the levels is that some of them haven't been adapted to the new game engine, meaning that certain gaps and goals are now more difficult to achieve than in the original games, one of the main examples of this is the venice beach level in which certain gaps and goals have had their difficulty unneccessarily increased, this down to the fact that your skater moves slower than in the classic games. The new engine is nice and it feels like they tried to emulate the THPS3 engine but with more realistic movement, however the game will sometimes throw you off your board even if you don't bail, this can be annoying when trying to get a high score. I'm not too bothered about the lack of multiplayer but local multiplayer/splitscreen would have been an asset here. I'm also dissapointed that you can't dismount your board in order to look around a level in order to find certain goals like in the THUG games. In conclusion it has potential but it feels rushed, it feels like they spent more time porting the levels and making all the movements seem hyper realistic that they forgot to see whether or not their game actually worked properly.tl;dr, buy this if its on sale like I did, otherwise stick to the older games as THUG, THUG-2 and THAW all feature updated versions of the classic levels

For example if you get too much air your charcter bails mid flight and just flys up until it resets. And this happens a lot! Here are a list of things wrong wth this game.-Buggy-Not a remake-Ugly (Graphics are not pretty)-Some music from the first games and some new, but the game tends to play the same tracks over and over, very iritating-NO level editor-No Character Creation-No key binding select-No graphics options except resolution-Serious lag in the controls-Just doesn't play like a tony hawk gameIf you are a fan of the originals than you will feel wierd playing this.  I just doesn't play like a tony hawk game, it feels like a Programming student tried to make a tony hawk game over night.  And not some Brilliant student either, like a C- student.  Try and find one of the first games and just play that instead, it will be way better i promise!

												EDIT: I gave this game a second chance and couldnt put it down. It is worth the $7.49 I paid. Your skater will bail often and it is annoying but it makes the game more challenging. The white screen you get when you bail is still annoying. Good music, some classics are in there. It's nice how the music continues to play from the level to the menu. you can buy "special tricks" like 360 flips and what not.What an awful game to be made in 2012. It's not even worth the $7.49 I paid. I've been playing Tony Hawk games since they came out and this is actually worst of them all. If your character is even a slight bit off when you land, you will bail. instead of the character getting up, it goes to an awful white screen and it restarts you. Sparks fly when you board slide (wtf). No online capability for PC users. WHERE THE F*** IS Chad Muska? And you can't do more than 8 flips, grabs, or grinds. I know this is a THPS 1 remake but com'n you couldn't add 360 flips and 360 shuvits? Also the default grind is a backside nose grind. should it be a 50-50? That last problem could be because of my controller but I'm not going to play this game again to find out because it sucks so bad.

												This is a good game if you need a fix of Tony Hawk games and you've already played the hell out of all the old ones. This is a decent installment in the franchise and deserves at least a buy. There isn't too much content. No create a skater or create a park, there's a lot of stuff missing. It chooses good maps from the First couple Pro Skater games, sadly only 7 maps though. The soundtrack isn't phenominal as it usually is, but it's still pretty great. There's not a whole lot of content, but that's why the game is 10 dollars and not 40. It's definitely worth a try, but it won't be what you've been waiting for from the Tony Hawk franchise all these years.

Поэтому я перестал играть в него, да и вообще уже наскучила езда на скейте, не говоря уже о графике!Но вот недавно я наткнулся на Тони HD - я тут же её запустил и начал играть, радость моя продолжалась недолго! Потому что управление стало каким-то неудобным, геймплей не радует, графика в HD размытая, даже музыка, характерная для этой игры не понравилась! Чего-то нового или каких то дополнений в игре просто нету - в общем это всё тот же Хоук, только в новой обёртке!Игра скучная, так что надолго она вас не затянет, потому что ей просто не чем это сделать! Ярым фанатам может быть и придётся по вкусу, но она явно не для ценителей.

												This game gets my vote for the best soundtrack ever... That's probably because I've loved the soundtrack to most Tony Hawk's games and played them all when they were originally released.  If you're a skater you will love this game as it has all the technical elements of skating and all the big names within the sport. If you're not a big skater you will still love this game as the controls are easy to pick up and it's a lot of fun pulling off big tricks that you only ever see on TV. Again this is one of those games that has been given the HD treatment and it works, bringing life back to the game franchise and making it a more enjoyable experience than playing the original.

er 7, 2014
												I went into this game blind. The only Tony Hawk game I ever played was THPS4 (and Ride, but that was dreadful.) I bought the game and the Revert pack at the same time. My pros and cons:Pros:Fluid and fast gameplayGreat character and level design (but it's a remake of THPS1 and 2, so that's a gibbon.)The cheats are delicious fun, including one that lets you play as classic Tony Hawk.The controls feel VERY natural, especially with a controllerCustomizable boards and unlockable characters make getting money funCons:Very glitchy. My board sometimes went sailing off into space and I go the opposite direction.The game likes to cheat with the big drops, telling you right before you fall on your face.The game is basically inaccessible to the newcomers without cheats.Goals become extremely hard in career mode. It asked me to get 3 roll call rails, but I couldn't tell what they were until I grinded on them.With all of that said, it's a very fun game. Many people might disagree, but I had a lot of fun, and I think you will too.Overall Score: 8/10

												It's somewhat enjoyable until you get your stats to a higher level. After that, it becomes waaay too floaty. I'm talking so floaty, the camera has a hard time keeping up, and it becomes a detriment to gameplay.  Forget about 100-percenting Downhill Jam. Things get so fast and floaty, it's impossible.

ber 29, 2015
												I really wish I could say more good things about this game.It's a sluggish, gutted, glitchy, disastrous attempt at capturing what made the first two THPS games so great. It doesn't help that this PC port was noticiably rushed out the door (no visual options, no online multiplayer, the UI doesn't even have controller button icons for goodness sake). The soundtrack, an important aspect of the Tony Hawk series, was really good though rather short. A 50/50 mix of new and old songs from 1 and 2 works really well with the updated level visuals. Speaking of which, the graphics aren't THAT bad like people make them out to be. They're good for the most part and since this is a budget title with (I hope) a smaller budget, one can't complain much. Seeing older levels in a shiny new coat gives a fuzzy, nostalgic feeling that some hardcore fans may want to pay the cash for. And hey, it isn't Tony Hawk RIDE ... Overall, it's below mediocre but may be worth it if you need a fix of old school THPS but with prettier visuals. Get it when it's on sale.

												As an afficionado of the series since the original THPS on PSX, I find this remake not only lacking in creativity, but also a step back from the by-gone era of "wheelie"-ing your way to massive combos in Marseille. It combines elements of the first 3 games and levels of the first 2 (IIRC), but playing it does not at all feel the same way. It's like a yellow milkshake that kinda tastes like the banana milkshake you've always loved, but leaves a disgusting aftertaste. Avoid if you're a fan.

The Revert move is included with DLC which means more money for needed longer combos. Trying to string long combos together is unpolished, and often a mess of improperly read move inputs. Overall for a memory trip and something to fill gaps of time, its ok to free stake and remember when these games pushed the boundries of a skateboarding game, but in all they don't stand well on their own and show what an empty shell this ones powerhouse used to be.

												Man did i waste 5 bucks or what.  This game is barley a tony hawk game and definentely not a remake or HD port or whatever.  Its a butchering of a classic series of great games.  Basically this game is not a port of the originals, its totally new, just the same levels from the first few games.  But it is as buggy as hell.  For example if you get too much air your charcter bails mid flight and just flys up until it resets. And this happens a lot! Here are a list of things wrong wth this game.-Buggy-Not a remake-Ugly (Graphics are not pretty)-Some music from the first games and some new, but the game tends to play the same tracks over and over, very iritating-NO level editor-No Character Creation-No key binding select-No graphics options except resolution-Serious lag in the controls-Just doesn't play like a tony hawk gameIf you are a fan of the originals than you will feel wierd playing this.  I just doesn't play like a tony hawk game, it feels like a Programming student tried to make a tony hawk game over night.  And not some Brilliant student either, like a C- student.  Try and find one of the first games and just play that instead, it will be way better i promise!

												Kind of love-hate relationship with this one. It's a very good remake of THPS1 and 2, however, the lack of a multiplayer function -either split screen or online- makes it be a little less valuable than it would be. However, pulling tricks in known locations, and now on the PC, is still worth your while. Grab it when it's on sale, you won't regret it.

ber 19, 2012
												I'll be honest, I feel very mixed about this game. The graphics aren't the best for an HD remake, they could of done better. More importantly, the feel of the game is somewhat worse than the classic versions. Jumping feels like you're floating and you sometimes ball out of random when trying to do a wallride or grind. The big fall seems to be a bigger problem than it was before, but that might be just me. Also, the PC version is just bad. There are no graphic settings or controll settings. So in conclusion, this game is fun, but different. Just bring a controller and a decent computer.

ber 21, 2012
												Instead of beating the dead horse that is skateboarding games Tony Hawk has gone back to basics with a remake of the original game to carry pro skater title. While everything bad about the newest games has been removed of course so were some of the improvements. Grinds & manuals can no longer be augmented mid trick and the segways from vertical to ground tricks are absent as well. Aside from a few minor changes and an HD repainting it's the same N64 classic you knew and loved (with an unfortunate reminder of downhill jam by a map of the same name to make sure too much fun isn't had).All in all it's a great piece of retro revival from a genre that was killed by those that made it popular. If you enjoyed this game fifteen years ago it's still as much fun today even if it does boil down to little more than a rerelease. If you're feeling nostalgic it's a great play as long as you don't expect much more than the original delivered.

12, 2015
												I've been a big fan of the tony hawks games for a long time. Thps1 and Thps2 on the PS1 gave me a lot of single player fun. The games after that gave me many hours of multiplayer fun. While i can appreciate this game for what its trying to be i just can't get into it like many of the later games. - Did i enjoy thps1 and 2? yes - Do i feel nostalgic about those games and gameplay? yes- Do i want to relive that level of gameplay and control NO. The thing about this game is that really doesn't settle with me is the controls, it really does feel like those early thps games which is obviously what they were aiming for but i feel like they really missed their peak with this remake. This should have been a game celebrating much more than just the original but celebrating the evolution of the series. Pros- Some different gameplay modes, projectives, hawkman, big head mode etc are all nice additions- Enough hours of gameplay to be something- looks great, how i would imagine the levels would look in modern day graphics- Soundtrack is nice has some of the original tracks and a few others- A great selection of levels from across the seriesCons- I miss graffiti, peds with goals, the usual game modes- no multiplayer- revert is a dlc? what the hell are you trying to be old thps style or not make up your mind- no create a skater/park/trick etc- its just lacking that neversoft touchOk so i will recommend this game but here are my recommendations..- If you like the original thps games you will like this.- If you haven't really played much thps games you will most likely get used to the gameplay and mostly enjoy this.- If you are someone who spent hours and hours of time playing thps3/thps4/thug/thug2 online or offline you will probably feel like me a little dissapointed but may enjoy it if you put in more than a few hours and get used to its quirks.
